Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and clearly label a specific land or water habitat (e.g., forest, pond).
The student can draw and label different kinds of plants found in the chosen habitat (e.g., trees, grasses, bushes).
The student can draw and label different kinds of animals found in the chosen habitat (e.g., lizards, squirrels, ants, fish).
The student can illustrate and label how plants and animals are similar or different in two different habitats.
The student can use their drawing to show patterns in the diversity of life between different habitats.
